did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Advisory Committee on the Status of Women records, 1970-2006.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Advisory Committee on the Status of Women.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes correspondence, minutes of meetings, reports, and subject files.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1972, Title IX of the Education Amendments decreed that educational institutions that receive federal financial assistance must eliminate gender biases in education. That same three of its faculty members, Alice Cook, Jennie Farley, and Gail McCall founded the Provost's Ad Hoc Committee on the Status of Women. This ad hoc group was eventually made permanent at Cornell University and renamed the Advisory Committee on the Status of Women (ACSW).

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, minutes of meetings, reports, and subject files.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Advisory Committee on the Status of Women.

prefercite.p: Advisory Committee on the Status of Women records, #53/26/3595. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
